title: How to Make a Party Bag

steps.headline: Cut the net fabric into a circle that is about 22 centimeter (8.7 in) across the middle.
steps.description: Cut the lining  fabric into a circle about 17 centimeter (6.7 in) across.

steps.headline: Spread out the fabric circle on top of the net and pin it.
Sew the edges of the lining to the net.
Turn the circles over so fabric is on top.
Use the needle to thread the elastic in and out of the net just outside the fabric circle.
steps.description: Pull the ends of the elastic tight and tie them together. Cut off the extra elastic.

steps.headline: Cut two small holes in the net about 10 centimeter (3.9 in) apart.
steps.description: Thread the ribbon through the holes and tie into a bow. Use the ribbon as a handle for your party bag.

methods.name: Filling in a ready-made bag or box

steps.headline: Ask your child what candies and chocolates he/she likes.
steps.description: Write some of the candies down on a piece of paper.

steps.headline: Add some toys to the list.
steps.description: Work out how many candies and toys you need altogether and whether you will get bags or noodle boxes.

steps.headline: Go shopping for the toys, chocolates, candies and bags or boxes.
steps.description: If wished, decorate the bags before filling them. Ribbon or curly ribbon are nice additions to a party bag.

steps.headline: Pack the party bags with the candies and toys.
steps.description: Don't show it your child because it is a secret until the party time.

steps.headline: You are finished!
steps.description: You also have the option to see the children eat the candies and play with the toys. Ask your child to see what they would like for the next party.

text: Netting party bag Cut the net fabric into a circle that is about 22 centimeter (8.7 in) across the middle. Cut the lining  fabric into a circle about 17 centimeter (6.7 in) across. Spread out the fabric circle on top of the net and pin it.  Sew the edges of the lining to the net.  Turn the circles over so fabric is on top.  Use the needle to thread the elastic in and out of the net just outside the fabric circle. Pull the ends of the elastic tight and tie them together. Cut off the extra elastic. Cut two small holes in the net about 10 centimeter (3.9 in) apart. Thread the ribbon through the holes and tie into a bow. Use the ribbon as a handle for your party bag. Fill as required.  Filling in a ready-made bag or box Ask your child what candies and chocolates he/she likes. Write some of the candies down on a piece of paper. Add some toys to the list. Work out how many candies and toys you need altogether and whether you will get bags or noodle boxes. Go shopping for the toys, chocolates, candies and bags or boxes. If wished, decorate the bags before filling them. Ribbon or curly ribbon are nice additions to a party bag. Pack the party bags with the candies and toys. Don't show it your child because it is a secret until the party time. You are finished! You also have the option to see the children eat the candies and play with the toys. Ask your child to see what they would like for the next party.
